column3: It's possible, but this doesn't solve any problems, and there various reasons for not doing it. This isn't part of the c++ standard so it could cause portability bugs. And most other c/c++ projects use ifdef include guards, and deviating from common practice could create confusion and inconsistency. For now, I'd suggest to keep the current style, as it serves its purpose.\n\nIf someone wanted to change that in the future, the [developer notes](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md#developer-notes) had to be adjusted first, giving a clear rationale for the change.

I see no reason to change this.\n\n@johnBuffer Thanks for trying to contribute, but if you want your contribution to be useful try to pick one of the open issues, for example one marked [good first issue](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22).
